title: Ticket #3619: Check/correct man page list
description:
Make sure we don't have man pages for commands that are no longer distributed; also make sure we have man pages for all commands that are distributed.

Possibly also check whether there are commands that we distribute that no longer function...
remarks:
2013-May-14 14:38:19 by wenger:
I'm still doing some checking on which commands are really dead. But there are a bunch of "live" commands that aren't documented yet:

From bin: [Make man page with 2 sentence descrip of bosco and pointer to bosco homepage at OSG]

  • bosco_cluster
  • bosco_findplatform
  • bosco_ssh_start
  • bosco_start
  • bosco_stop
  • bosco_uninstall

Get rid of the binaries in release tarball for these:

  • classad_functional_tester
  • classad_version
  • condor_test_match
  • condor_userlog_job_counter

From sbin:

  • bosco_install (make stub staying this is the same as condor_configure in this mode, for supporting BOSCO - link to Bosco on the web)
  • condor_install (make stub staying this is the same as condor_configure in this mode)

(I'm kind of guessing about what stuff in sbin needs man pages. And the division between bin and sbin is not very clear -- why is bosco_install in sbin, but bosco_uninstall in bin?)

2013-May-15 13:42:16 by wenger:
Okay, these are the man pages we need to remove:

  • cleanup_release
  • condor_cold_start
  • condor_cold_stop
  • condor_config_bind
  • filelock_midwife
  • filelock_undertaker
  • install_release
  • uniq_pid_midwife
  • uniq_pid_undertaker

2013-May-15 14:25:33 by wenger:
I've edited things so that the man pages and the html versions for the obsolete commands are no longer produced; I'm going to assign this back to Karen -- I guess she can try to get the appropriate people to write man pages for the new commands (I don't know enough about them to do that).

2013-Jun-04 16:05:26 by wenger:
Okay, the actual man page changes are done (hopefully they'll get reviewed). The only thing left is the sub-ticket about removing obsolete binaries. Therefore, I'm going to change this ticket to the review state and assign it back to Karen.

2013-Jun-13 12:02:37 by smoler:
Karen Miller [REVIEW]: All stub man pages are in place, and links to outdated man pages are removed.
